text: hi i'm melina rising and I'm here at the
Museum of Modern Art for the opening of
a Lucian Freud exhibit it's his first
solo show at the MoMA so the opening
party has drawn a lot of people from all
different worlds for music from design
from architecture art openings are the
world's best source of free white wine
and cute shoes it's a pretty stylish
crowd even Rufus Wainwright is here
well I'm a big Freud's fan the last
great kind of painter of the 20th
century his work and also I'm a big
friend of with Bela Bela is very good
his daughter who's also one of the
subjects this was the first picture I
sat for and I was 16 I just left home
and moved to London and I used to come
and sit like three nights a week and
we'd work till about 1:00 in the morning
or midnight and then we'd often go out
for a drink afterwards
I was familiar with his paintings I was
not familiar with his etchings which I
think are extraordinary
what do you make of the explosion in the
prices for Contemporary Art I don't
understand it but you know maybe there's
an explosion of everything and this is
just symptomatic of that it's like
everybody is an artist like everybody
needs a fashion design you know I almost
want to be a nun so I want to deal with
what do you think about the fashion of
this party there isn't it
I got my hairs on at Frederic Fekkai
what do you think about the fashion of
this opening very avant-garde with all
the black but that's very typical but
you know what it always needs a little
spice enough you know so the Whitewater
step flowing the cute shoes are walking
out we didn't learn what makes the art

pompadour
